  • public class Gomoku

    Programming Project 5
    Gomoku class
    The class represent a Gomoku game.

    Trung Nguyen Huynh

                              int idRow,
                              int idColumn)
        Check if the current position is valid or not
        Parameters:
        board - 2-dimensional array describing the game board
        idRow - current X position
        idColumn - current Y position
        Returns:
        true if the next position is valid; otherwise, return false.

      • isWin

        public static boolean isWin(int[][] board,
                            int idRow,
                            int idColumn,
                            int numNeedToWin)
        Check if the move at the current position can help the player win the game immediately
        Parameters:
        board - 2-dimensional array describing the game board
        idRow - current X position
        idColumn - current Y position
        numNeedToWin - the number of continuous squares needed to win the game
        Returns:

      • isThreeThree

        public static boolean isThreeThree(int[][] board,
                                   int idRow,
                                   int idColumn,
                                   int numNeedToWin)
        Check if the move at the current position violates the three-three rule or not
        Parameters:
        board - 2-dimensional array describing the game board
        idRow - current X position
        idColumn - current Y position
        numNeedToWin - the number of continuous squares needed to win the game
        Returns:

      • processMove

        public int processMove(int[][] board,
                       int idRow,
                       int idColumn,
                       int numNeedToWin)
        Helper method: Process the move when a button is clicked + Check if the player can win + Check if the player violates 3-3 or 4-4 rule and print the message to notificationBar + Set the appropriate color for button and showCurrentPlayer
        Parameters:
        board - the game board
        idRow - row index of the button
        idColumn - column index of the button
        numNeedToWin - the number of continuous squares needed to win the game
        Returns:
        1 if the player can win; -1 if the square is occupied or there is already the winner; -2 if 4-4 rule is violated; -3 if 3-3 rule is violated; 0 if the move is valid

      • start

        Parameters:
